intro: Thapsia nestleri subsp. flabellata, commonly known as the Canary Island thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or grayish hue, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
